page.title: 09BUILDINGS 3
page.content:
(1871), the former Methodist Church on West Street (1878) and the Foresters Arms. At about the same time St. George's Church and the lodge on the south side of the Churchyard were restored. On open land large detached houses such as the Vicarage, Hillside and Earlham on St. George's Street were showing a new approach to development.
Post 1900 In the 20th century local authority housing had the greatest impact on new development in the area. During the early 1920's the previously undeveloped area of West Close was developed. During the 1950's and early 1970's a few old people's bungalows were built at the south end of the village off Mill Lane.
